private_information: I am permitted to move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is largest of my set).
I can move only one disk at a time and I cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal is reached: left peg becomes (top→bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg becomes (top→bottom) A; right peg becomes (top→bottom) B, C.

private_information: I am permitted to move disks: F, G, H, I, J.
I can move only one disk at a time and I cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal is reached: left peg becomes (top→bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg becomes (top→bottom) A; right peg becomes (top→bottom) B, C.

private_information: I am permitted to move disks: K, L, M, N, O.
I can move only one disk at a time and I cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the global goal is reached: left peg becomes (top→bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg becomes (top→bottom) A; right peg becomes (top→bottom) B, C.

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and integrate their move lists into a single valid plan.
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem aimed at the FastDownward planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive moves into a valid cooperative plan that achieves the global goal and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward.

public_information: This is a standard three-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest.
Only the top disk of any peg can be moved at any time.
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg holds, top to bottom, A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg should hold, top to bottom, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle peg should hold, top to bottom, A. Right peg should hold, top to bottom, B, C.
Agents have restricted move permissions: agent_1 may move A-E, agent_2 may move F-J, agent_3 may move K-O.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Consider the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step, respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions, and output only the ordered list of moves.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. You know the public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The team goal is: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide a sequence of primitive moves you will execute, in order, formatted as 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. You may only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Consider the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step, respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions, and output only the ordered list of moves.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. You know the public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The team goal is: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide a sequence of primitive moves you will execute, in order, formatted as 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_3: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. You may only move disks K, L, M, N, O. Consider the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_3->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_3->goal}. Think step by step, respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions, and output only the ordered list of moves.
moves.prompt: You are agent_3. You know the public environment facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. The team goal is: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Provide a sequence of primitive moves you will execute, in order, formatted as 'agent_3: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator for a multi-agent Tower of Hanoi planning instance. You will receive the ordered primitive move lists from three agents. Your job is twofold. First, integrate and, if necessary, reorder or reconcile the moves so the combined sequence is a valid cooperative plan that respects Tower of Hanoi rules and each agent's disk permissions. Second, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward planner that represents the multi-agent action capabilities and the initial and goal states. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the agents' actions distinct and indicate which agent can perform which moves in the domain. Think step by step and output only the combined validated move list followed by the PDDL domain and problem.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the move lists produced by the three agents. The global goal is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. The public environment facts are {environment->public_information}. Here are the agents' proposed moves: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3}. Integrate and validate these moves into a single ordered plan that obeys Tower of Hanoi rules and the agents' disk restrictions. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver that captures the multi-agent capabilities and the initial and goal configurations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Output the validated combined move list first, with each line formatted as 'agent_i: move disk X from pegY to pegZ', then the PDDL artifacts.
